fields.name: OpenStreetMap Data (Generic)
fields.service_description:
OpenStreetMap vector data provided in the 'planet' tables. 

All points, lines, and polygons are three separate tables.
fields.config:
planet_osm_point:
  types:
    - points
  select:
    - name

planet_osm_line:
  type:
    - lines
  select:
    - name

planet_osm_polygon:
  type:
    - polygons
  select:
    - name

fields.name: OpenStreetMap Data (Themes)
fields.service_description:
OpenStreetMap vector data provided in a custom thematic schema. 

Data is grouped into separate tables (e.g. water, roads...).
fields.config:
overpass_query: '[maxsize:$maxsize][timeout:$timeout];(relation($bbox);way($bbox);node($bbox);<;(._;>;));out body;'

amenities:
  types:
    - points
    - polygons
  select:
    - amenity
    - name
    - addr:housenumber
    - addr:street
    - building
    - historic
    - information
    - leisure
    - shop
    - tourism
    - office
    - religion
  where: amenity IS NOT NULL

aviation:
  types:
    - points
    - polygons
    - lines
  select:
    - aeroway
    - name
    - surface
    - source
    - building
    - icao
    - iata
    - type
  where: aeroway IS NOT NULL 

places:
  types:
    - points
    - polygons
  select:
    - place
    - name
    - is_in
  where: place IS NOT NULL

buildings:
  types:
    - polygons
  select:
    - building
    - name
    - addr:housenumber
    - addr:street
    - hazard_prone
  where: building IS NOT NULL

natural:
  types:
    - lines
    - polygons
  select:
    - natural
    - name
    - hazard_prone
  where: natural IS NOT NULL

landuse:
  types:
    - polygons
  select:
    - landuse
    - name
  where: landuse IS NOT NULL

roads:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - highway
    - barrier
    - ford
    - hazard_prone
    - name
    - traffic_calming
    - tunnel
    - layer
    - bicycle_road
    - bridge
  where: highway IS NOT NULL

rail:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - railway
    - name
    - bridge
    - cutting
    - embankment
    - frequency
    - service
    - tracks
    - tunnel
    - usage
    - voltage
    - source
    - operator
    - layer
  where: railway IS NOT NULL

waterways:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - waterway
    - name
    - hazard_prone
  where: waterway IS NOT NULL

towers_antennas:
  types:
    - points
  select:
    - man_made
    - name
  where: man_made IN ('antenna','mast','tower')

harbours:
  types:
    - points
  select:
    - harbour
    - name
    - leisure
    - landuse
  where: harbour IS NOT NULL

leisure:
  types:
    - polygons
  select:
    - leisure
    - name
  where:  leisure IS NOT NULL

fields.name: NOME
fields.service_description:
Data provided by the NSG Open Mapping Enclave.  NOME is an NGA volunteered geographic information (VGI) operational prototype that enables all NGA customers to contribute their knowledge.  Vector data  grouped into separate tables (e.g. water, roads...)

https://nome.vgihub.geointservices.io
fields.config:
amenities:
  types:
    - points
    - polygons
  select:
    - amenity
    - name
    - addr:housenumber
    - addr:street
    - border_control
    - building
    - historic
    - information
    - leisure

    - office
  where: amenity IS NOT NULL

places:

buildings:

    - polygons

    - addr:street
    - hazard_prone
  where: building IS NOT NULL

natural:
  types:
    - lines
    - polygons
  select:
    - natural
    - name
    - hazard_prone
  where: natural IS NOT NULL

landuse:
  types:
    - polygons
  select:
    - landuse
    - name
  where: landuse IS NOT NULL

roads:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - highway
    - barrier
    - ford
    - hazard_prone
    - name
    - traffic_calming
    - tunnel
    - layer
    - bicycle_road
    - bridge
  where: highway IS NOT NULL

rail:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - railway
    - name
    - bridge
    - cutting
    - embankment
    - frequency
    - service
    - tracks
    - tunnel
    - usage
    - voltage
    - source
    - operator
    - layer
  where: railway IS NOT NULL

waterways:
  types:
    - lines
  select:
    - waterway
    - name
    - hazard_prone
  where: waterway IS NOT NULL

towers_antennas:
  types:
    - points
  select:
    - man_made
    - name
  where: man_made IN ('antenna','mast','tower')

harbours:
  types:
    - points
  select:
    - harbour
    - name
    - leisure
    - landuse
  where: harbour IS NOT NULL

leisure:
  types:
    - polygons
  select:
    - leisure
    - name
  where:  leisure IS NOT NULL

fields.name: DigitalGlobe Imagery (Foundation GEOINT)
fields.service_description:
Imagery in this service is selected on its utility for vector data extraction, meaning the imagery tends to have a low off-nadir angle and good rectification quality.  See the NGA World Imagery layer or the DigitalGlobe Imagery Tile Service layer for imagery selected for visual appearance. 

Use of DigitalGlobe imagery is governed by the NextView license agreement. See the Account Settings page for more details. DigitalGlobe provides global satellite imagery outside of the United States.

fields.name: OpenStreetMap Tiles
fields.service_description:
OpenStreetMap data is rendered into stand-alone raster tiles using a cartography style based on the OSM Standard style.  The only difference is that all features are rendered in English language, as well as the native language, if a the English version is available.  

More information about the copyright of the OSM tiles is found here: https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright

fields.name: DigitalGlobe (ImageryTileService)
fields.service_description:
Imagery in this service is selected on the basis of visual appearance, and is useful for a consistent map background


Use of DigitalGlobe imagery is governed by the NextView license agreement. See the Account Settings page for more details. DigitalGlobe provides global satellite imagery outside of the United States.

fields.name: GVS Scanned Maps
fields.service_description: This map provides global scanned maps and charts comprised of Compressed Arc-Digitized Raster Graphics (CADRG) and Enhanced Compressed Raster Graphics (ECRG). This service displays the most appropriate scanned map and charts for each scale or level of detail (LOD). The following standard products are included in this version of the CADRG basemap; and are listed from smallest scale to largest scale: Global Navigation Chart (GNC), Jet Navigation Chart (JNC), Operational Navigation Chart (ONC), Tactical Pilotage Chart (TPC), Joint Operations Graphic–Air (JOG-A), Topographic Line Map (TLM) at 1:100,000, 1:50,000, 1:25,000, and 1:24,000, Military Installation Map (MIM), Combat Charts (CC), and CityGraphics (CG). Both the CC and CG products vary in scale from 1:50,000 to 1:10,000.

fields.name: USGS Elevation
fields.config:
service:
  scale: "15"
  coverages: "DEP3Elevation"
params:
  TRANSPARENT: true
  FORMAT: geotiff
  VERSION: '1.0.0'
  CRS: 'EPSG:4326'
  REQUEST: 'GetCoverage'

fields.name: USGS Hydrology
fields.config:
vector_layers:
  - name: 'WBDLine'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/0'
  - name: 'Region'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/1' 
  - name: 'Subregion'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/2' 
  - name: 'Basin'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/3' 
  - name: 'Subbasin'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/4'
  - name: 'Watershed'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/5'
  - name: 'Subwatershed'
    url: 'https://hydrowfs.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/wbd_WFS/MapServer/6'

fields.name: GVS Terms of Use
fields.text:
GVS Terms of Use UNCLASSIFIED//FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY GVS-ENG-129 v2.0
04 April 2018
UNCLASSIFIED//FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY ii
Geospatial-Intelligence Visualization Services (GVS)
Terms of Use
GVS-ENG-129
Version 2.0
04 April 2018
Prepared For:
National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA)
7500 GEOINT Drive
Springfield, VA 22150

(U) SUMMARY OF NGA'S GEOSPATIAL-INTELLIGENCE (GEOINT)
VISUALIZATION SERVICES (GVS)
(U) The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) Geospatial-Intelligence (GEOINT) Visualization Services (GVS) Services (Services) are provided under the authority of the Secretary of Defense (SECDEF) and the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) pursuant to the National Imagery and Mapping Agency Act of 1996
(10 USC section 441 et seq.) and the National Security Act of 1947, as amended (50 USC section 403 et seq.). The current version of these "Terms of Use" is accessible by clicking on the hyperlink located on the perimeter of the NGA websites.

(U) GVS TERMS OF USE
(U//FOUO) The GVS Program is one of the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency's (NGA's) flagship programs that delivers geospatial visualization capabilities and services to the Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC) via classified and unclassified computer networks.
(U//FOUO) The goal of GVS is to enhance the imagery and geospatial analysts' exploitation experience by providing comprehensive, web-services based, 2-D and 3-D GEOINT visualization services and environments to enable automated information access, staging and organizational service, visualization of the information in a
geospatial context, geospatial analysis services, and integration with reporting services.
(U//FOUO) GVS provides robust geospatial visualization, information sharing and collaboration capabilities for the National System for Geospatial-Intelligence (NSG), Intelligence Community, the DoD and its national defense partners (US, Allied, and coalition partners), homeland security, diplomatic, and law enforcement partners on the World Wide Web, NIPRNet, SIPRNet, and JWICS.
(U) Under the direction of the NGA Information Technology (IT) Services Director, GVS provides the operational means to deliver enabling geospatial visualization services supporting the objectives of the NSG and the DoD Designed Enterprise Service for Geospatial Visualization on behalf of the DoD Chief Information Officer (CIO) as part of Defense Information Systems Agency's (DISA) Net-Centric Enterprise Services (NCES) Program.
Specifics of these services are located on the GVS Homepages.

(U) General Usage Provisions
(U) Use of GVS Services is limited to official government business. Use of GVS Services for personal/nonofficial use (e.g., casual browsing, gaming, entertainment, personal communications, commerce) is prohibited.
Prohibited uses of GVS Services include:
- (U) Use of file sharing technologies, also known as Peer-to-Peer (P2P) software, unless specifically authorized in writing by the appropriate information system security official
- (U) Unauthorized acquisition, use, reproduction, transmission, or distribution of any controlled information including computer software and data, that includes privacy information, copyrighted, trademarked or material with other intellectual property rights (beyond fair use), proprietary data, or export controlled software or data
- (U) Making offensive, indecent, harassing, or disparaging statements
- (U) Making disparaging statements concerning race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, or political expression
- (U) Streaming video/audio unrelated to official business
- (U) Unlawful or unauthorized access to personally identifiable information related to United States Persons

(U) NGA Services collect and maintain activity (audit) logs of browsing activity. These logs are made available upon request by an authorized security/law enforcement official (e.g., Information/Computer Security Officer, Inspector General).

(U) Domestic Imagery
(U//FOUO) GVS serves as a broker to existing content, expertise, and services across the NSG. GVS enables existing sourced and collected NSG content through derived online, on-demand, geospatial web services. This content supports the full spectrum of NSG missions, many of which are non-intelligence functions and exempted from the Department of Defense's intelligence oversight procedures. Because GVS merely enables access to content, and does not collect or exploit content for an intelligence purpose, GVS does not constitute a Foreign Intelligence (FI) or Counterintelligence (CI) activity for purposes of DoD Manual 5240.01 or the NSG domestic imagery policy, NSG Instruction 1806. Although GVS platforms provide access to domestic imagery and data subject to NSG Instruction 1806, none of the GVS platforms are required to maintain a Proper Use Memorandum.
(U//FOUO) Any user of GVS seeking to collect, exploit, or disseminate domestic imagery through GVS must comply with the requirements of NSG Instruction 1806, including the requirement for a Proper Use Memorandum when collecting domestic imagery for a Foreign Intelligence (FI) or Counterintelligence (CI) purpose. GVS
systems that provide access to domestic imagery will apply access control measures and log auditable information about access requests. Any user seeking to collect domestic imagery through GVS must have a valid mission requirement for that imagery.

(U) Intelligence Oversight
(U) As a broker to existing content, GVS performs a non-intelligence function for purposes of the Department of Defense's intelligence oversight procedures. Systems with NGA-provided base layers are performing a mapping, charting, and geodetic function that is not governed by Department of Defense Manual 5240.01.
(U) If a GVS user introduces intelligence reporting to the system, either manually or by linking to an external database, that information may be subject to DoDM 5240.01. The Department of Defense defines U.S. Person Information (USPI) as information that is reasonably likely to identify one or more specific U.S. persons, including names or unique titles, street addresses, and telephone numbers. GVS users must comply with all laws, policies, and procedures applicable to the protection of USPI. Users introducing USPI into a GVS system must identify any access and use limitations applicable to the USPI being provided.
(U) The use of a GVS system to intentionally collect USPI for a Foreign Intelligence (FI) or Counterintelligence (CI) purpose requires a prior legal review from NGA's Office of General Counsel (OGC). Any questions about the applicability of DoD's intelligence oversight procedures to GVS operations should be directed to the NGA OGC.

(U) External Links
(U) The appearance of hyperlinks does not constitute endorsement by the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency or this Web site or the information, products or services contained therein. For other than authorized activities such as military exchanges and Morale, Welfare and Recreation sites, the National Geospatial-
Intelligence Agency does not exercise any editorial control over the information you may find at these locations.
Such links are provided consistent with the stated purpose of this DoD Web site.

(U) Security and Consent to Monitoring
(U) For security purposes and to ensure that these Services remain available to all users, this Government computer system employs software programs to monitor network traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to access, change, or otherwise cause damage. Anyone using this system expressly consents to such monitoring
and is advised that if such monitoring reveals evidence of possible abuse or criminal activity, such evidence may be provided to appropriate law enforcement officials. Unauthorized attempts to access, change, or otherwise cause damage on this system are strictly prohibited and may be punishable by administrative discipline, civil penalties, and/or criminal prosecution under the provisions of the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986 and the National Information Infrastructure Protection Act of 1996 (18 USC section 1030). The following security banner/notice is required on all NGA websites and websites registered on NGA:

- (U) Notice and Consent Log-on Banner
- (U) This is a United States (US) Government computer system. This computer system, including all related equipment, networks, and network devices, including Internet access, are provided only for authorized US Government use. US Government computer systems may be monitored for all lawful purposes, including ensuring that their use is authorized, for management of the system, to facilitate protection against unauthorized access, and to verify security procedures, survivability, and operational security. Monitoring includes authorized attacks by authorized US Government entities to test or verify the security of this system. During monitoring, information may be examined, recorded, copied, and used for authorized purposes. All information including personal information, placed on or sent over this system may be monitored.
- (U) Use of this US Government system, authorized or unauthorized, constitutes consent to monitoring of this system. Unauthorized use may subject you to criminal prosecution. Evidence of unauthorized use collected during monitoring may be used for administrative, criminal or other adverse actions.
(U) Servers registered on NGA systems require the use of an equivalent to the above log-on banner prior to registration of websites on NGA Services.

(U) Classified National Security Information
(U) Information derived from or created as a consequence of the use of NGA Services may be subject to classification as national security information in accordance with Executive Order 12958, as amended. The Executive Order prescribes a uniform system for classifying, safeguarding, and declassifying national security information. It also establishes a monitoring system to enhance its effectiveness.
(U) Classified information, regardless of its form, shall be afforded a level of protection against loss or unauthorized disclosure commensurate with its level of classification. Authorized persons who have access to classified information are responsible for: (a) Protecting it from persons without authorized access to that information, to include securing it in approved equipment or facilities whenever it is not under the direct control of an authorized person; (b) Meeting safeguarding requirements prescribed by the agency head; and (c) Ensuring that classified information is not communicated over unsecured voice or data circuits, in public conveyances or places, or in any other manner that permits interception by unauthorized persons.
(U) Questions concerning the classification, safeguarding, and declassifying national security information should be directed to your local security officer.

(U) User Accounts, Passwords, and Security
(U) Some NGA Services may require registration and the use of a password and/or user identification. Individual users are responsible for protecting the confidentiality of passwords against unauthorized disclosure or use by another individual. Individuals are accountable for the actions and behaviors used under these accounts.
(U) In the event a Non-Person Entity (NPE) certificate has been issued to grant users access to GVS provided services or data, it is the responsibility of Local Registration Authority to validate NPE certificate requirements and authenticate subscribers for their particular agencies/organization. Such organizations have the responsibility to ensure a proper mechanism is followed (e.g., username/password) prior to returning protected GVS data through an NPE.

(U) Protection of Personal Information
(U) The Privacy Act of 1974 (as Amended), Public Law 93-579, requires Federal agencies to inform individuals when they are asked to provide their Social Security Numbers (SSN) and other personal identifiers. In the event a SSN is requested, you are hereby advised that the authority for soliciting your SSN is Executive Order 9397.
A SSN may be used for individual identification and integrity functions within NGA identification or authorization mechanisms. NGA does not typically request or require SSNs. NGA primarily uses names, email addresses, and organizational information to enable use of its Services.
(U) Posting of, or making available, personal identifiers such social security account numbers may violate an individual's right to privacy under the Privacy Act (5 USC 552a) and is prohibited.

(U) Crawling, Indexing, and Search Policy
(U) Search engine tools are typically referred to as robots, crawlers, walkers, or spiders that use hyperlink structures of web-based content to find and index content. NGA search engines are the only content indexing mechanisms authorized to crawl Intelligence Community hosts visible on Community networks. This facilitates
broad community access to shared content as well as providing the capability address general community needs (e.g., security incidents/spills response, bandwidth limitations).
(U) The NGA search engine indexes HTML and non-HTML content (e.g., pdf, word processing, spreadsheets, graphics, presentations, and text files). The NGA search mechanisms honor the Robots Exclusion Protocol. A "robots.txt" files should be used to limit indexing of named directories (e.g., private content, cgi-bin directories).
Our responsibility to limit adverse impacts from indexing is taken very seriously. Problems with NGA crawlers accessing community websites should be reported immediately via email to NGA.

(U) Official Federal Agency Record Responsibilities
(U) Section 3101 of Title 44 USC requires the head of each Federal agency to make and preserve records containing adequate and proper documentation of the rganization, functions, policies, decisions, procedures and essential transactions of the agency and designed to furnish the information necessary to protect the legal and financial rights of the Government and of persons directly affected by the agency's activities. Federal employees have three basic obligations for making and keeping records of their work including:
- (U) Creating records needed to do the business of their agency, record decisions and actions taken, and document activities for which they are responsible
- (U) Taking care that records are kept so that information can be found when needed. This means setting up good directories and files, and filing materials (in whatever format) regularly and carefully in a manner that allows them to be safely stored and efficiently retrieved when necessary
- (U) Carrying out the disposition of records under their control in accordance with agency records schedules and Federal regulations
- (U) Management of record material created or used as a consequence of the use of NGA Services, is the responsibility of the individual user and his/her agency.

(U) Cookies
(U) A "cookie" is small amount of data, typically an anonymous but unique identifier, sent to a browser by a web server and may be saved to user's computer to facilitate convenient use of certain website features. Session cookies are used for the duration of a session connection with the visited website. Session cookies are typically deleted at the end of a browsing session - when the browser is closed. Persistent cookies are saved to a user's computer to allow recognition of a user and/or their preferences the next time the user visits the same website.
(U) Some NGA Services features use persistent cookies to provide seamless navigation and recognition of user preferences previously set by the user. Web browsers allow a user to configure how cookies behave - allow/disallow or control the use of cookies. Certain features of NGA Services work best when persistent cookies
are allowed by the browser.

(U) Copyrights, Intellectual Property, and Commercial Content
(U) Generally, materials produced by Federal agencies are in the public domain and may be reproduced without permission. However, not all content provided via NGA Services is in the public domain. Some content is licensed or obtained from individuals, organizations, or commercial entities and may be subject to restrictions on use.
(U) Some NGA Services contain commercial content (e.g., Janes, CNN, Weather) licensed by the United States Government under specific license agreements that govern its use. Reproduction or redistribution of the commercially provided or licensed content is prohibited by law, and may result in civil and criminal penalties.
You may consult our staff for details on specific items. We will be able to refer you to our content providers, but may not be able to confirm the copyright status of specific items.
(U) Images and other material used on NGA systems that are in the public domain may be used without restriction. Some material on NGA systems have been obtained from other agencies. Permission to use these materials should be obtained directly from those agencies/organizations.

(U) Availability of Public Domain or Open Source Software
(U) Public domain or open source software may be made available on NGA systems for the convenience of the user community when deemed appropriate and consistent with the objectives for which NGA Services are provided. The availability of these resources does not constitute or imply its endorsement, recommendation, suitability determination for any purpose, or favoring by the United States Government. Verification and compliance with any licensing requirements is the exclusive responsibility of the user and organization using any software made available through NGA Services. Local policy requirements or restrictions may also apply to the use of such software. Continued availability of any or all these resources is subject to the exclusive discretion of NGA management.

(U) Disclaimer of Endorsement
(U) Reference to, or identification of, any specific commercial products, process, or service by trade name, trademark, manufacturer, or otherwise, on any NGA Service does not constitute or imply its endorsement, recommendation, or favoring by the United States Government. The views and opinions of authors expressed herein do not necessarily state or reflect those of the United States Government, and shall not be used for advertising or product endorsement purposes. Neither the United States Government nor any of its employees, makes any warranty, expressed or implied, including merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or assumes any liability or responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of any information, apparatus, product, or process disclosed, or represents that its use would not infringe privately owned rights.

(U) Disclaimer of Content
(U) GVS is a service provided for collaboration of GEOINT. GVS, NGA, and the Federal Government do not guarantee the accuracy of information provided on this site by users. Opinions, analysis, or data provided on this sight does not represent the views or the endorsement of GVS, NGA or the United States Government.
Users agree that they must validate the accuracy of any information through their own validation methods. This site uses information from many different sources, the accuracy of which cannot be guaranteed by GVS, NGA, or the United States Government.

fields.name: ODC Open Database License (ODbL)
fields.text:
ODC Open Database License (ODbL)
Preamble
The Open Database License (ODbL) is a license agreement intended to
allow users to freely share, modify, and use this Database while
maintaining this same freedom for others. Many databases are covered by
copyright, and therefore this document licenses these rights. Some
jurisdictions, mainly in the European Union, have specific rights that
cover databases, and so the ODbL addresses these rights, too. Finally,
the ODbL is also an agreement in contract for users of this Database to
act in certain ways in return for accessing this Database.

Databases can contain a wide variety of types of content (images,
audiovisual material, and sounds all in the same database, for example),
and so the ODbL only governs the rights over the Database, and not the
contents of the Database individually. Licensors should use the ODbL
together with another license for the contents, if the contents have a
single set of rights that uniformly covers all of the contents. If the
contents have multiple sets of different rights, Licensors should
describe what rights govern what contents together in the individual
record or in some other way that clarifies what rights apply.

Sometimes the contents of a database, or the database itself, can be
covered by other rights not addressed here (such as private contracts,
trade mark over the name, or privacy rights / data protection rights
over information in the contents), and so you are advised that you may
have to consult other documents or clear other rights before doing
activities not covered by this License.

The Licensor (as defined below)

and

You (as defined below)

agree as follows:

1.0 Definitions of Capitalised Words
???Collective Database??? ??? Means this Database in unmodified form as part
of a collection of independent databases in themselves that together are
assembled into a collective whole. A work that constitutes a Collective
Database will not be considered a Derivative Database.

???Convey??? ??? As a verb, means Using the Database, a Derivative Database,
or the Database as part of a Collective Database in any way that enables
a Person to make or receive copies of the Database or a Derivative
Database. Conveying does not include interaction with a user through a
computer network, or creating and Using a Produced Work, where no
transfer of a copy of the Database or a Derivative Database occurs.
???Contents??? ??? The contents of this Database, which includes the
information, independent works, or other material collected into the
Database. For example, the contents of the Database could be factual
data or works such as images, audiovisual material, text, or sounds.

???Database??? ??? A collection of material (the Contents) arranged in a
systematic or methodical way and individually accessible by electronic
or other means offered under the terms of this License.

???Database Directive??? ??? Means Directive 96/9/EC of the European
Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 1996 on the legal protection
of databases, as amended or succeeded.

???Database Right??? ??? Means rights resulting from the Chapter III (???sui
generis???) rights in the Database Directive (as amended and as transposed
by member states), which includes the Extraction and Re-utilisation of
the whole or a Substantial part of the Contents, as well as any similar
rights available in the relevant jurisdiction under Section 10.4.

???Derivative Database??? ??? Means a database based upon the Database, and
includes any translation, adaptation, arrangement, modification, or any
other alteration of the Database or of a Substantial part of the
Contents. This includes, but is not limited to, Extracting or
Re-utilising the whole or a Substantial part of the Contents in a new
Database.

???Extraction??? ??? Means the permanent or temporary transfer of all or a
Substantial part of the Contents to another medium by any means or in
any form.

???License??? ??? Means this license agreement and is both a license of rights
such as copyright and Database Rights and an agreement in contract.

???Licensor??? ??? Means the Person that offers the Database under the terms
of this License.

???Person??? ??? Means a natural or legal person or a body of persons
corporate or incorporate.

???Produced Work??? ??? a work (such as an image, audiovisual material, text,
or sounds) resulting from using the whole or a Substantial part of the
Contents (via a search or other query) from this Database, a Derivative
Database, or this Database as part of a Collective Database.

???Publicly??? ??? means to Persons other than You or under Your control by

or a Substantial part of the Contents by the distribution of copies, by

Re-utilisation of insubstantial parts of the Contents may amount to the
Extraction or Re-utilisation of a Substantial part of the Contents.

???Use??? ??? As a verb, means doing any act that is restricted by copyright

publicly displaying, and preparing derivative works of the Database, as

fields.name: NOME Terms of Use
fields.text:
WARNING
You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for use by authorized personnel only. By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:
Intrusion Detection

For site security purposes and to ensure that this service remains available to all users, we employ software programs to monitor traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to defeat or circumvent security features, to use the system for other than intended purposes, to deny service to authorized users, to access, obtain, alter, damage, or destroy information, or otherwise to interfere with the system or its operation is prohibited. Evidence of such acts may be disclosed to law enforcement authorities and result in criminal prosecution under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986 and the National Information Infrastructure Protection Act of 1996 (Pub. L. 104-294), (18 U.S.C. 1030), or other applicable criminal laws.


Disclaimer of liability
Content on this site is sponsored by the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA). Neither the U.S. Government nor any agency thereof, or any of their employees, makes any warranty, express or implied, or assumes any legal liability or responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of any information, apparatus, or product generated directly from this content.


Content Use Restrictions
THIS SITE IS FOR THE COLLECTION OF FEATURE DATA IN SUPPORT OF MAPPING INITITIAVES BY NGA AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. The data itself is unclassified, but should be protected against unauthorized release to organizations outside the trusted network of users. The data is not approved for public release except in situations (natural disaster, terrorism, or significant event) where it may become necessary for a partner to share with external entities to prevent further loss of life. Users of this system are not required to seek permission to use the data in this capacity, but NGA would request users send an email to the NSG Open Mapping Enclave manager (VGITeam@nga.mil) to highlight the data they intend to share, and the format they plan to use (hardcopy map, shapefiles, map service, etc). If organizations have specific questions regarding potential public release they may direct them to the NGA Office of General Counsel (OGC).


OpenStreetMap
OpenStreetMap (OSM) content is a part of this service. The users of this system must adhere to the Open Database License (ODbL) agreement for that content. Users in our environment may adapt content within our private database, however you may not publically share this data unless it falls into one of the categories listed in the content use restrictions.

What does this mean to users?
Users in this environment may utilize the data to generate maps or content in support of operations. Those hardcopy products may be shared with operational partners, but may not be used as part of public facing maps on the WorldWideWeb. Any use of data from this environment to generate a public facing map is subject to release to the public in accordance with OSM licensing requirements. https://www.openstreetmap.org.

fields.name: NEXTVIEW IMAGERY END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT
fields.text:
Notice for NGA Employees:
This app gives users the ability to collect domestic imagery. Any use of the app that involves the collection of domestic imagery must be in accordance with the NGA Domestic Imagery Policy. Note that such collection may require a PUM, or review by the NGA Office of General Counsel and/or Privacy and Civil Liberties Office. Use of this app must also be in accordance with the intelligence oversight requirements set forth under DoDM 5240.01. This app may only be used for official business. Audio recordings are only permitted for user notes.

1.  Introduction.  This End User License Agreement ("EULA") 
    is between DigitalGlobe, Inc., a Delaware Corporation 
    ("DigitalGlobe" or "Seller") and National Geospatial-
    Intelligence Agency ("NGA"), the purchaser of this EULA, 
    which governs the use of the data products or documentation 
    ("Products") accompanying this EULA in accordance with 
    Contract NMA 301-03-3-0001 (the "Contract").
2.  Applicability. This license applies to imagery and products 
    licensed under the Contract, including data downlinked to 
    domestic and foreign ground stations.
3.  License Granted and Permitted Uses.  
    a.  General Terms
1.  This clause applies to all unprocessed sensor data and requirements-compliant processed imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived    products and imagery support data     licensed under this Contract. No other clauses related to intellectual property or data rights of any sort shall have any effect related to the unprocessed sensor data and requirements-compliant processed imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived products and imagery support data delivered under this Contract.
2.  All license rights for use of the unprocessed sensor data and requirements-compliant processed imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived products and imagery support data provided to the U.S. Government purchased under this NGA contract are in perpetuity. 
3.  Licensed users may generate an unlimited number of hardcopies and softcopies of the unprocessed sensor data and requirements-compliant processed imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived products and imagery support data for their use.
4. (i) Licensed users may generate any derived 
    product from the licensed unprocessed sensor 
    data; and requirements-compliant processed 
    imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived 
    products and imagery support data.
  (ii) Unprocessed sensor data and requirements-        compliant processed imagery, imagery services,  imagery-derived products and imagery support    data licensed under this NGA contract have no   restrictions on use and distribution, but shall     contain the copyright markings.
    b. Licensed Users
1. The imagery may be used by the U.S. Government (including, all branches,departments, agencies, and offices).  
2. The U.S. Government may provide the imagery to the following organizations: 
    State Governments
    Local Governments
    Foreign Governments and inter-governmental organizations
    NGO's and other non-profit organizations
    
3. In consideration for the flexibility afforded to the U.S. Government by allowing unprocessed sensor data and requirements-compliant processed imagery, imagery services, imagery-derived products and imagery support data to be shared, the United States Government shall use its reasonable best efforts to minimize the effects on commercial sales. Acquisition and dissemination of imagery and imagery products collected within the United States shall be restricted in accordance with law and regulation.
DigitalGlobe, Inc.  
NextView EULA_5749 Rev 1.0 
08/10/05
